full_summary:
### Call for Bids: CF-18 Avionics In-Service Support

**Contract Name:** CF-18 Avionics In-Service Support

**Solicitation Number:** W8485-22AVS2/C

**Publication Date:** May 5, 2023

**Closing Date and Time:** June 15, 2023, at 14:00 Eastern Time

**Government of Canada Contracting Authority:** Public Works and Government Services Canada

**Region of Delivery:** Alberta, Quebec (except NCR), and National Capital Region (NCR)

**Trade Agreements Apply:**

* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Notice Type:**

* Request for Proposal (RFP)
* Competitive - Open bidding

**RFP Number:** PW_BG_006_29059

**Description:**

Public Works and Government Services Canada invites interested parties to participate in a single competitive procurement process for the long-term in-service support services for designated CF-188 Avionics Systems (AVS), Automatic Test Equipment (ATE), and specialized support equipment, including material management and logistics services for the Department of National Defence.

The in-service support contract will include the following activities:

* Program Management Services
* Engineering Services
* Maintenance, Repair, and Overhaul (MRO) Services
* Materiel Management and Logistic Services
* Technical Information Support

**Evaluation Criteria:**

* Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price

**Submission Documents:**

The complete RFP document is available upon request. Interested parties may submit a proposal in either official language of Canada.

**Contact Information:**

For further information, please contact:

Matthew MacLean
Public Works and Government Services Canada
Department of National Defence, Directorate of Aerospace Equipment Program Management - Fighters & Trainers
(343) 576-2979 (voice)

matthew.maclean@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

Please note that the Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. The deadline to submit proposals is June 15, 2023, at 14:00 Eastern Time. The evaluation of proposals will be based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.
